Key Match Events: Virat Kohli hit an unbeaten 82 to haul India over the line
India needed 28 runs off the final eight balls, two huge sixes from Kohli helped reduce that equation to 16 off the final over
Hardik Pandya (40) was lost off the first ball of an extraordinary over
Kohli hit a six off a waist-high no ball off the fourth ball to keep India in the game
Ravichandran Ashwin hit the final ball over mid off, belying the tension of the occasion, to win the game for India
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played out in front of a capacity crowd of 90,293 fervent supporters at the MCG
Others: Having been sent in to bat by India, Pakistan had to fight hard to reach a competitive total
India too struggled early with KL Rahul (4) and Rohit Sharma (4) both departing for single-digit scores
Suryakumar Yadav (15) fell soon after, squeezed by a rising ball from Haris Rauf to quieten India's raucous fans

Mohammad Rizwan looked to have messed up a routine run out — he even turned away in disgust after failing to take the ball cleanly from Babar Azam's throw — but third umpire Richard Kettleborough ruled that the ball had broken the bails before his gloves did and Axar Patel (2) had to go
Pandya and Kohli's 113-run partnership for the fifth wicket helped rebuild India's seemingly faltering chase
Both unloaded in the 12th over though, launching Nawaz for three sixes to regain some momentum
Kohli continued his superb record with the bat against Pakistan, reaching his half century in the 18th over as India hit 17 runs off Shaheen to give themselves every chance
An otherwise excellent 19th over from Rauf looked to give Pakistan back the advantage, but two incredible sixes from Kohli set up India's remarkable heroics in the final over
Kohli reached his half century in the 18th over as India hit 17 runs off Shaheen to give themselves every chance
Historical comparisons or records beyond: This was the match that fans and neutrals alike had circled as the one to watch from the Super 12 stage
